info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 6:36AM EDT until July 10 at 11:17AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Delaware...
White Clay Creek Near Newark affecting New Castle County.
For the White Clay Creek...including Newark...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White Clay Creek near Newark.
* WHEN...Until late this morning.
* IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins into adjacent open fields. At 13.3 feet, Delaware Route 7, Stanton Christiana Road, begins to flood. At 13.5 feet, Businesses on Delaware Route 7 begin to flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 AM EDT Thursday was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this morning and continue falling to 4.5 feet tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 11/30/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi.
The next statement will be issued this morning at 1130 AM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS MORNING
